title: Taraxacin - Wikipedia
text:
Taraxacin
[IUPAC name](/wiki/Chemical_nomenclature)
1,5,8-trimethyl-3a,4-dihydroazuleno[6,5-b]furan-2,6-dione
SCHEMBL456260, CHEMBL449951
3D model (
[JSmol](/wiki/JSmol)) [ChEMBL](/wiki/ChEMBL) [ChemSpider](/wiki/ChemSpider) [PubChem](/wiki/PubChem)CID
- InChI=1S/C15H14O3/c1-7-4-12(16)14-8(2)5-13-11(6-10(7)14)9(3)15(17)18-13/h4,6,13H,5H2,1-3H3
- Key: BAHMQESJBKGPTE-UHFFFAOYSA-N
- CC1=C(C(C=C2C)=O)C2=CC(C3C1)=C(C)C(O3)=O
[Molar mass](/wiki/Molar_mass)
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their
[standard state](/wiki/Standard_state)(at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
Taraxacin is a
[guaianolide](/wiki/Guaianolide) with the molecular formula C15H14O3 which has been isolated from the plant [Taraxacum officinale](/wiki/Taraxacum_officinale). [[1]](#cite_note-Taraxacin2-1) [[2]](#cite_note-2) Taraxacin has a bitter taste. [[3]](#cite_note-3) [[1]](#cite_note-Taraxacin2-1) [[4]](#cite_note-4) Taraxacin has diuretic properties. [[5]](#cite_note-5)
